Job Posting:170413 - Position: F25 Intern, Frontend Software Engineer, Fall 2025 170413B Co-op Work Term Posted: 2025 - Fall App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 06/12/2025 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 06/05/2025 03:29 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Website Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country Autodesk Inc. https://autodesk.wd1.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/uni/details/Intern-- AI-Research-Scientist--Motion-Generation_24WD82922 Unit 107 - 661 University Ave Toronto M5G 1M1 ON Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION 2025 - Fall F25 Intern, Frontend Software Engineer, Fall 2025 170413B Co-op Position Toronto, ON Canada 4 months Hybrid CAD 0.0 per hour for 40 Major List Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Job Description Job Requisition ID # 24WD82753 Position Overview The Digital Experience Platform Team is focused on the digital experience for Autodesk customers. We are motivated by the mission to deliver a world-class customer experience that differentiates Autodesk in the marketplace, drives brand loyalty, and delivers our long-term financial results. As a Frontend Software Engineer Intern, you will work with the team to build applications that help the Autodesk customer experience journey. Responsibilities • You'll develop features in JavaScript, Node.js, and React.js • Improve the performance, availability and scalability of our applications • Partner with the Engineering Team to lead parts of the sprint ceremonies • Learn the team's ins and outs and about the experiences we deliver for our customers Minimum Requirements • Must be currently enrolled in a full-time, degree seeking program with an expected graduation date in 2026 Strong CS Fundamentals utilizing JavaScript applications • Preferred Requirements: • Prior software engineering experience from internships, hackathons, or other side projects • Knowledge of React Understanding of using AWS and CI/CD • About the Canada Intern Program The Fall 2025 Canada Internship program runs for 16 weeks (September 2 - December 19, 2025). All internships are paid. As an intern, you will contribute to meaningful projects, be mentored by industry leaders, and participate in tech talks and other activities designed to support your personal and professional development. Our internships align with Autodesk's Flexible Workplace approach, which is designed to meet the needs of our business while providing flexibility in support of office, remote and hybrid work preferences. Learn More About Autodesk Welcome to Autodesk! Amazing things are created every day with our software - from the greenest buildings and cleanest cars to the smartest factories and biggest hit movies. We help innovators turn their ideas into reality, transforming not only how things are made, but what can be made. We take great pride in our culture here at Autodesk - our Culture Code is at the core of everything we do. Our values and ways of working help our people thrive and realize their potential, which leads to even better outcomes for our customers. When you're an Autodesker, you can be your whole, authentic self and do meaningful work that helps build a better future for all. Ready to shape the world and your future? Join us! Salary transparency Salary is one part of Autodesk's competitive compensation package. Offers are based on the candidate's experience, educational level, and geographic location. Diversity & Belonging We take pride in cultivating a culture of belonging and an equitable workplace where everyone can thrive.
